title: Where do I find someone to help me write a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a great question. Like most people on this thread, I’m not sure what kind of a book you’re talking about — fiction? non-fiction? memoir? Truth be told, it doesn’t matter much. Start where you are. The best place to find someone to help you write a book is to look around at the people you know. When you’re starting, the best thing you can do is write something and have someone read it. This can be done online, of course, with a blog. However, your best help will come from someone you trust and who loves you. Write something and let them read what you wrote. Get their feedback. Figure out where you’re week. Write something else. One last thought: Stephen King’s wife reads everything he writes before it goes to beta readers. One final thing — the world needs your story, whatever it is, now. It’s time to get going. Thank you for asking for me to answer your question. I hope it helps.

Go on Meetup or check with your local library to find a writing group. Other writers are a great resource. Also there are a number of excellent books out there on writing by people who’ve been down the first book road. Here’s a post that has a list of my favorite writing books by genre — Sandra O'Donnell, Ph.D.'s answer to What are the best books people can read if they want to improve their writing? I have a writing book as well that is targeted specifically at first time writers and those working on a story that doesn’t seem to be coming together — Your First Fifteen Pages: An agent’s guide to writing a novel editors will publish and readers will buy! And I give a lot of writing advice on Your First 15 Pages and on RO Literary | Home under the blog. I hope you find these resources helpful. Happy Writing!
